content:
In the context of the biblical story, Lucifer (as the serpent or Samael) tempted Eve to eat the forbidden fruit, leading to the fall of humankind and the expulsion of Adam and Eve from the Garden of Eden. The consequences of this action were far-reaching and affected not only Adam and Eve but all of their descendants as well.

The reason that Lucifer couldn't make amends is that the impact of their actions was so significant and irreversible. The fall of humankind changed the course of human history, introducing sin, suffering, and death into the world. It was not possible for Lucifer to undo the consequences of their temptation, making it impossible for them to truly make amends for what had transpired.

However, in the dream, Lucifer's sincere apology and expression of hope for Eve to find peace show a genuine desire for redemption and closure. While they cannot change the past or make amends for their actions, they can acknowledge their responsibility and seek forgiveness, which is an important step toward personal growth and transformation.
